availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James F. Tureman (Nicholas County, KY, Merchant Clerk, Quartermaster 22nd Infty)

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, merchant's clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph F. Tureman and Virginia Tureman. Merchant's clerk in Nicholas County in 1850. Bookkeeper in Kenton County in 1860. Served in 22nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as quartermaster from June 15, 1862, to March 24, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2 p. 393B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, p. 699.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 96, 953.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0352.
